article.para: eXist-db provides a library for the Ant build tool to automate common system administration and operation tasks, like backup/restore or importing files. Ant is included in the eXist-db distribution (only if you've installed the eXist-db source code).

sect1.title: Common attributes
sect1.para: All tasks share the following common attributes:

listitem.para: An XMLDB URI specifying the database collection through XMLRPC. For instance xmldb:exist://localhost:8080/exist/xmlrpc/db/my-collection-my-resource.xml.
All collection and resource paths specified in the tasks are relative to this.
Use SSL encryption when communicating with the database (default: false).
The user to connect with (default: guest).
Password for the user (default: guest).
Whether or not a error should stop the build execution (default: true).

sect1.title: Storing Documents
sect1.para: The store task uploads and stores documents into the database. Documents are specified as single source file or with Ant filesets:

listitem.para: If set to true, non-existing base collections are automatically created.
If set to true, non-existing sub-collections are automatically created.
The type of the resource: either xml or binary. If binary, documents will be stored as binary resources. If unset, the type will be guessed from identified MIME type.
The default MIME type to use when the resource's MIME type cannot be identified. Default: binary (application/octet-stream).
Use this attribute when you want to force the MIME type. Also set type attribute (because resource kind guessing is disabled in this mode).

The mime-types.xml file used to identify the resource's kind (binary or xml) and MIME type. If not set eXist-db's default MIME types file will be used. An example MIME types file can be found in the eXist-db installation directory.
a single source file to store. Use either this or Ant filesets.
The permissions for the resource, expressed in a Unix-style form, e.g. rwxr-xr-x. Permissions will be applied to the resource/collection after it is created.

sect1.title: Removing Documents/Collections
sect1.para: The remove task removes a single resource or a collection:
Attributes (use either collection or resource, not both):

listitem.para: The name of the collection to remove.
The name of the resource which should be removed.

sect1.title: Creating Empty Collections
sect1.para: The create task creates a single, empty, collection:

listitem.para: The name of the collection to create.
The permissions to be applied to the collection, expressed in a Unix-style form, e.g. rwxr-xr-x. Permissions will be applied to the collection after it is created.

sect1.title: Check Existence of Resource/Collection
sect1.para: The exist task is a condition that checks whether a resource or collection as specified in the uri attribute exists or not. An ant target can be executed conditionally, depending on the property set or not set by the condition.

listitem.para: The name of the resource to check. If you don't specify this, the existence of the collection in the uri attribute is checked.

sect1.title: List Resources/Collections
sect1.para: The list task returns a list of resources and/or collections:
Attributes:

listitem.para: If true lists resources
If true lists collections
Separator character for the returned list. Default: ",".
Name of the (new) Ant property for the result

sect1.title: Copy a Resource/Collection
sect1.para: The copy task copies a resource or collection:
Attributes (use either collection or resource, not both):

listitem.para: The name of the resource to copy.
The name of the collection to copy.
The name of the destination collection to copy to.
The new name of the resource or collection.

sect1.title: Move a Resource/Collection
sect1.para: The move task moves a resource or collection:
Attributes (use either collection or resource, not both):

listitem.para: The name of the resource to move.
The name of the collection to move.
The name of the destination collection to move to.
The new name of the resource or collection.

sect1.title: Process an XPath Expression
sect1.para: The xpath task executes an XPath expression on a single or a collection of XML documents.
Attributes:

listitem.para: The XPath expression to process.
Run the XPath query on this resource instead of a collection.
If true, the number of results is returned (instead of the results themselves).
Name of the (new) property for returning the results of the query in.
Write the results of the query to this destination file. Care should be taken to get a well-formed document (one root tag!).
Optional XML namespace for the query.

sect1.para: If you don't specify an output property or destination file, the results are discarded.

sect1.title: Process an XQuery Expression
sect1.para: The xquery task executes an XQuery expression:
Attributes:

listitem.para: The full query to process.
The query to process, specified as a URI.
Name of the (new) property for returning the results of the query in.
Write the results of the query to this destination file. Care should be taken to get a well-formed document (one root tag!).
The query to process, specified as a filename.

sect1.para: The XQuery may also be specified as text content of the element.

Passing variables to the XQuery script can be done using one or more nested variable child elements. Declare these variables in your XQuery script as external. For instance, a variable passed as <variable name="test" value="Yup"/> can be accessed in the XQuery script as declare variable $beta external;:

sect1.title: Extract a Resource/Collection
sect1.para: The extract task extracts XML resources or collections with XML resources to disk. Extraction of binary resources is not supported.
Attributes:

listitem.para: The name of the resource to extract.
If true all sub-collections of the specified collection are extracted as well.
The name of the destination file to extract to on extracting a resource.
The name of a destination directory to extract to on extracting a collection.
If true directories for sub-collections will be created. Otherwise all extracted resources are written to the same destination directory.
Type of the resource to extract. Only xml is supported currently.
Set to true to force overwriting of files.

sect1.title: Backup
sect1.para: The backup task creates a backup of the specified database collection on disk:
Attributes:

listitem.para: The directory where the backup files will be stored.

sect1.title: Restore
sect1.para: The restore task restores database contents from a backup.
Attributes (use either dir or file, not both):

listitem.para: The directory (containing a __content__.xml file) to restore.
A zip file which contains the backup to be restored.

sect1.para: The groups task lists all user groups defined in eXist-db:
Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of (new) property to write the output to.
Separator character for the returned list. Default: ",".

Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of (new) property to write the output to.

Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of the resource to lock.

Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of the new user.
Name of the new user's home collection.

sect1.para: The rmuser task removes a user:
Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of the user to remove.

The new password.

Attributes:

sect1.title: Change Resource Permissions
sect1.para: The chmod task changes the permissions of a resource or collection.
Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of the resource to modify. If no resource has been specified, chmod will operate on the collection specified by the uri attribute.
Permission modification string. Use either Unix-style syntax like rwxrwx--- or additive/subtractive syntax like [user|group|other]=[+|-][read|write|execute], comma separated.
For example, to set read and write permissions for the group, but not for others:
The new settings are OR-ed with the existing settings.
DEPRECATED: Permission modification string. Use permissions instead.

sect1.title: Change Owner of resource/collection (chown)
sect1.para: The chown task changes the owner of a resource or collection.
Attributes:

listitem.para: Name of the user to own the resource/collection.
Name of the user group to own the resource/collection.

sect1.title: Database Shutdown
sect1.para: The shutdown task will shut down the database instance listening at the provided URI.
